cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW and then NW over the eastern Gulf, curve N toward the Florida Big-Bend late Wednesday-Thursday, then accelerate NE off the Southeast U.S. coast and out into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then Atlantic coastline from Florida through the Carolinas and adjacent Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight (â‰¤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds near the Delaware Bay late this week; breezy conditions more likely than damaging winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Delaware River and upper Delaware Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible late week, but totals likely below 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey and Delaware beaches late week into the weekend.
